misuses.misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
misuses.description: The use of the PBEKeySpec with a low iteration number and short key size is considered a risky or broken cryptographic algorithm. This can be exploited by attackers to perform attacks such as brute force attacks or dictionary attacks.
misuses.recommendation: To fix this misuse, it is recommended to use a stronger and more secure cryptographic algorithm with a higher iteration number and longer key size. Additionally, it is important to use a salt that is unique and unpredictable for each encryption operation.
